The Case of Mahāpajāpatī Gotamī

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṁ nigrodhārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmin nigrodha ārāme
translated: At one time the Buddha was staying in the Sakyan country, at Kapilavatthu in the Banyan Tree Monastery.

original: Atha kho mahāpajāpati gotamī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi.🔽Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho mahāpajāpati gotamī bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—🔽“sādhu, bhante, labheyya mātugāmo tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjan”ti.

translated: Mahāpajāpatī Gotamī went to the Buddha, bowed, and stood to one side.🔽She said to him, “Sir, it would be good if women were allowed to go forth into homelessness on the spiritual path made known by the Buddha.”

original: “Alaṁ, gotami, mā te rucci mātugāmassa tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjā”ti.
analyzed: ala gotami mā te rucci mātugāmassa tathāgata ppavedite dhamma vinaye agārasmaā anagāriyam pabbajjāti
translated: “No, Gotamī, women should not be allowed to do so.”

original: tatiyampi kho mahāpajāpati gotamī bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: tatiyam pi khalu mahāpajāpati gotamī bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and a third time Mahāpajāpatī Gotamī said to the Buddha,🔽“Sir, it would be good if women were allowed to go forth into homelessness on the spiritual path made known by the Buddha.”

original: “sādhu, bhante, labheyya mātugāmo tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjan”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante labheyya mātugāmo tathāgata ppavedite dhamma vinaye agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjanti
translated: “It would be good, Sir, if women could receive the going forth on this spiritual path made known by the Buddha.”

original: “Alaṁ, gotami, mā te rucci mātugāmassa tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjā”ti.

translated: “Enough, Gotamī. Don’t rejoice in women receiving the going forth on this spiritual path made known by the Buddha.”
Mahāpajāpatī then thought,

analyzed: na bhagavā anujānāti mātugāmassa tathāgata ppavedite dhamma vinaye agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjanti
translated: “The Buddha doesn’t allow women to go forth on this spiritual path made known by the Buddha.”

original: dukkhī dummanā assumukhī rudamānā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.🔽Atha kho bhagavā kapilavatthusmiṁ yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā yena vesālī tena cārikaṁ pakkāmi.🔽Anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno yena vesālī tadavasari.

translated: She was distressed, and with tears on her face she bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with her right side toward him, and left.🔽When the Buddha had stayed at Kapilavatthu for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Vesālī.

original: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā vesāliyaṁ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṁ.

translated: She then had her hair cut off, put on ocher robes, and set out for Vesālī with a large group of Sakyan women.🔽She eventually arrived at the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.

original: Atha kho mahāpajāpati gotamī sūnehi pādehi rajokiṇṇena gattena dukkhī dummanā assumukhī rudamānā bahidvārakoṭṭhake aṭṭhāsi.🔽Addasā kho āyasmā ānando mahāpajāpatiṁ gotamiṁ sūnehi pādehi rajokiṇṇena gattena dukkhiṁ dummanaṁ assumukhiṁ rudamānaṁ bahidvārakoṭṭhake ṭhitaṁ.

translated: With her feet swollen and covered in dust, and miserable and tearful, she stood outside the gateway.🔽Venerable Ānanda saw her there,

translated: “Why are you standing there like that?”

translated: “Well then, Gotamī, please wait here for a moment while I ask the Buddha to allow women to go forth.”🔽Ānanda then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

analyzed: sace ānanda mahāpajāpati gotamī aṭṭha garu dhamme paṭiggaṇhāti sa avassā

original: Vassasatūpasampannāya bhikkhuniyā tadahupasampannassa bhikkhuno abhivādanaṁ paccuṭṭhānaṁ añjalikammaṁ sāmīcikammaṁ kātabbaṁ.

translated: A nun who has been fully ordained for a hundred years should bow down to a monk who was given the full ordination on that very day, and she should stand up for him, raise her joined palms to him, and do acts of respect toward him.

original: Ayampi dhammo sakkatvā garukatvā mānetvā pūjetvā yāvajīvaṁ anatikkamanīyo.

original: Na bhikkhuniyā abhikkhuke āvāse vassaṁ vasitabbaṁ.
analyzed: na bhikkhuniyāḥ abhikkhuke āvāse vassam vasitabba
translated: A nun should not enter the rains residence in a monastery without monks.

original: Ayampi dhammo sakkatvā garukatvā mānetvā pūjetvā yāvajīvaṁ anatikkamanīyo.
